intro: Ononis natrix var. melillensis, commonly known as the Melilla bedstraw, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula and North Africa. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
